item.title: Postgres 11 Hash Partitioning Part1
item.description: Goal: Have postgres partition your large dataset to smaller tables. This entire post is detailed explanation of a thread in postgresql mailing list and wonderful answers by David Rowley Why do I need partitions? I already have an index! A partition is a logical unit that can be drop-ed and removed from queried dataset as well as the database detached from the queries dataset, but kept in the database for adhoc queries detach-ed and attach-ed somewhere else Whenever optmizer decides to fall back to a sequential scan, you would be scanning a smaller table.
